sentences: Kummalgi vastasel on partii algul 20 kabendit.
Vene kabel mängib kummalgi vastasel partii algul 12 kabendit.
Mees ja naine võistlesid lauatennises, males ja kabes - vastasena üksteisele.
context: The Estonian word 'vastasel' is the elative case form of 'vaste', meaning 'opponent' or 'adversary'. In this context, it refers to the opposing player in a game. The word appears most commonly in descriptions of board games like checkers (kabe), where 'kummalgi vastasel' means 'each opponent has... at the beginning of the game'. The elative case indicates movement from or separation, so 'vastasel' can be understood as '[from] the opponent' or used to indicate which opponent is being referred to in a comparative sense.
